heaviest_rainfall.status: On 09 November 2025, a record rainfall of 47.89mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  24.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 34.3mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 47.89mm with a maximum intensity of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 02 February 2026 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 0 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (200°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 27 January 2026 with a value of 128.2 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 107 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 210 m) and inside temperature (up 1.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 107.0m lower than yesterday, 159.6m lower than the past week, 209.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 604m minimum and 818m maximum, with an average of 575.9m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 735.5m and 785.5m.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, overcast skies with low cloud, and the light is absent. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (6.1°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
